column5: Hey guys, looking for hardwater this weekend.. any one have an ice report for lake Niapenco? still 2 more nights of cold weather to freeze her too...
Best to go to their website.  http://www.npca.ca/conservation-areas/binbrook/
I was walking all over it today with the dog. Not sure how much ice exactly, but it's frozen hard as a rock with almost no snow cover.
Suppose they'll open up for the weekend?
Maybe it hasn't been updated, might be worth a call to see if its changed
Ill wait till tommorow night to give them a call, hopefully shes ready for the weekend!
I hope so because it's going to warm up again on Monday and Tuesday :/
All the other small lakes are safe in the area. Long Point Bay is safe. Dunnville is safe. I'm willing to bet there's six inches of ice.

Binbrook is still not safe due to high winds that kept it open even when the deep freeze.It is now frozen over but some spots are less than the 6 inches of black ice needed to open. With a staffed park there are issues with health and safety regulations so they have to have a strict policy in place...
